TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ModifierKeysConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Converts a object to and from other types.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ModifierKeysConverter converts to and from a using the "+" character as the delimiter. For example, the string `Control+ALT` would be converted into a object consisting of the and keys. This behavior differs from the default XAML parser-level enumeration combine character of ",". ## XAML Text Usage

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeysConverter> converts to and from a <xref:System.String> using the "+" key as the delimiter. For example, the string `Control+ALT` would be converted into a <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys> consisting of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys> and <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys> keys.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `destinationType` must be <xref:System.String>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeysConverter> converts to and from a <xref:System.String> using the "+" key as the delimiter. For example, the string `Control+ALT` would be converted into a <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys> consisting of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys> and <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys> keys.

Docs.exception: does not map to a valid .
